DataElement.preferredName: Natural History Surgical Or Protocol Procedure Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text name of a surgical or operative procedure used in a Natural History protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Natural History Surgical Or Protocol Procedure Name
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The systematic account of natural phenomena; in medicine, the elucidation and description of disease progress._Of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Natural History Surgical Or Protocol Intervention or Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The systematic account of natural phenomena; in medicine, the elucidation and description of disease progress.:of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Concepts.definition: A study that monitors the development and progression of a disease or condition with no emphasis on diagnosis or treatment.
of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Property.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part of the pancreas, duodenum, and distal part of the bile duct.  Sometimes, the lower portion of the stomach and the gallbladder are also removed.  This procedure is performed for pancreatic, ampullary, duodenal and distal bile duct cancers.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part of the pancreas, duodenum, and distal part of the bile duct.  Sometimes, the lower portion of the stomach and the gallbladder are also removed.  This procedure is performed for pancreatic, ampullary, duodenal and distal bile duct cancers.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial or complete resection of the omentum.

Concepts.definition: Partial or complete resection of the omentum.
Endoscopic examination of peritoneum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation to remove the spleen.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the spleen.
Surgical removal of the gallbladder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (il-ee-AHS-toe-mee) An opening into the ileum, part of the small intestine, from the outside of the body. An ileostomy provides a new path for waste material to leave the body after part of the intestine has been removed.

Concepts.definition: Surgical creation of an external opening into the ileum for fecal diversion or drainage. Loop or tube procedures are most often employed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure involving the partial or complete resection of the sigmoid colon.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure involving the partial or complete resection of the sigmoid colon.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the transverse colon.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the transverse colon.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the left part of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the left part of the colon.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure to eradicate or reduce small tumors using radiowaves to generate heat. The procedure is performed by the insertion of a thin needle through the skin and into a tumor, which is guided by computed tomography (CT) or ultrasound. Electrical energy delivered through this needle (electrode) heats and destroys the tumor. This therapeutic option is widely utilized by patients that have inoperable cancers, or are unsuitable chemotherapy candidates.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure to kill tissue using radiowaves to generate heat. The procedure is performed by the insertion of an electrode into a target tissue. Electrical energy delivered to the electrode heats and destroys the tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Endoscopic examination of the luminal surface of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Endoscopic examination of the luminal surface of the colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (en-do-SKAH-pik RET-ro-grade ko-LAN-jee-o-PAN-kree-a-TAW-gra-fee). A procedure to x-ray the pancreatic duct, hepatic duct, common bile duct, duodenal papilla, and gallbladder. In this procedure, a thin, lighted tube (endoscope) is passed through the mouth and down into the first part of the small intestine (duodenum). A smaller tube (catheter) is then inserted through the endoscope into the bile and pancreatic ducts. A dye is injected through the catheter into the ducts, and an x-ray is taken.

Concepts.definition: A procedure in which the bile ducts, pancreatic duct, and gallbladder are examined using a combination of endoscopy and fluoroscopy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tube that is inserted through the nose, down the throat and esophagus, and into the stomach. It can be used to give drugs, liquids, and liquid food, or used to remove substances from the stomach. Giving food through a gastric feeding tube is a type of enteral nutrition.

Concepts.definition: A hollow tube that is directed into the stomach from the nose.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
